alert.note: Alert for Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 9:00AM CDT until August 25 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for... Southwestern Baldwin County in southwestern Alabama... South Central Mobile County in southwestern Alabama... * Until noon CDT. * At 900 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fairhope, Point Clear, Silverhill, Alabama Port, Battles Wharf, Mon Louis, Faustinas, Sunny Cove, Barnwell, Smithport, Bayleys Corner, Belle Fontaine, South Orchard, Delchamps, Fowl River, Kirewakra, Laurendine and Clay City. High rainfall rates in excess of 2 inches per hour have been common this morning. These rainfall rates along with backbuilding storms may result in additional heavy rainfall and flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches will be possible over the next one to two hours and a Flash Flood Warning may be needed if these rainfall rates materialize.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
